property_description:
Live in world-class design at KHUN by YOO, a luxury condominium in the heart of Thonglor, inspired by Philippe Starck. This 149.5 sqm, 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom unit on the 23rd floor is fully furnished with high-end electronics and ready to move in. Minimum stay is 30 days, offering both comfort and style for short- or long-term stays.

Residents enjoy exclusive facilities across multiple floors: a swimming pool, sauna, and steam room on the 24th floor; fitness center, library, and meeting room on the 25th floor; and a sky lounge and game room on the 27th floor, providing a perfect mix of relaxation, wellness, and entertainment.

Ideally located near Thonglor’s vibrant lifestyle offerings: BTS Thonglor 1.2 km, EmQuartier 2.1 km, Emporium 2.5 km, Major Cineplex Ekamai 1.6 km, and Samitivej Hospital 1 km. A rare opportunity to enjoy luxury city living in central Bangkok.

property_description:
Feel the Space and Views

This 108 sqm condo is one of those rare finds where you really get a sense of openness and light. Thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows, the living room and bedrooms are bright throughout the day, and you’ll probably spend a lot of time on that large balcony—it's got glass panel railings and either wooden or tiled flooring, perfect for relaxing while looking out over the golf course and the Bangkok skyline.

Layout & Practicality

The place has two bedrooms and two bathrooms, both designed to feel fresh and modern. The master bathroom even has a spacious bathtub with sleek fixtures, plus a glass partition that separates it from the bedroom area—adds to that open, airy feel. The kitchen’s modern setup includes a built-in electric cooktop, stainless steel range hood, and an integrated dishwasher. It’s all about clean lines and function here, with under-cabinet LED lighting and white cabinetry keeping the space bright and uncluttered.

Comfort & Style

  • Minimalist decor with touches like beige leather sectional sofa and wall-mounted flatscreen TV
  • Elegant dining area featuring a black rectangular table and chic crystal chandelier
  • Thoughtful details such as blackout curtains, recessed ceiling lights, and air conditioning vents to keep things comfortable year-round

Situated in Lumphini within Pathum Wan, you get a perfect mix of green views with that unmistakable urban energy. Also, it’s freehold, so you own it outright. All in all, if you value style, natural light, and a spacious layout with fantastic views, this one’s worth a visit.

property_description:
Roomy and Well-Equipped Living Space

This condo is really something if you need space and a bit of luxury without jumping into a full house. It’s on the 8th floor, giving you some nice views, and with 7 bedrooms and 8 bathrooms, it’s perfect for a big family or if you want extra rooms for guests or work-from-home setups.

Kitchen That Works for You

The kitchen’s got a clean, bright feel thanks to white cabinets and glass-front doors. You’ll find a large stainless steel fridge, built-in oven and stovetop, plus a central island with storage and a hanging rack for pots—makes cooking feel functional and a bit special. The polished stone floors and pendant lights above the island add a polished touch.

Bathrooms and Comfort

Multiple baths include some nice features like a clawfoot tub, walk-in glass shower with rainfall showerhead, and toilets with bidet sprays. Vanities have mirrored wooden cabinets and good lighting, so getting ready is easy and comfortable.

Details and Atmosphere

  • Wood plank flooring and black & white tiled floors give character
  • Built-in wardrobes with mirrors make storage easy
  • Warm wall sconces and recessed lighting create a cozy vibe
  • Decorative rugs and a four-poster bed add a bit of charm
  • Comfortable living area with an upholstered sofa and mounted TV

With 5 garage spaces and freehold ownership, this place balances practicality and style. It’s a resale, so it has a lived-in feel but well-maintained. If you’re looking for space and thoughtful details, it’s worth coming by.

property_description:
Welcome to a Comfortable, Light-Filled Bangkok Home

This 152 sqm condo on the 20th floor gives you plenty of space without feeling overwhelming. You’ve got three bedrooms and four bathrooms, which is perfect if you need extra privacy or guest space. The bedrooms are medium-sized and bright, especially thanks to the large windows that look out over the city—great if you enjoy waking up to natural light and those skyline views.

The master bedroom feels really inviting with a gray upholstered headboard featuring nailhead trim, set against beige padded wall panels, which gives it a cozy but modern touch. Neutral bedding with a splash of green from the throw adds a subtle pop of color. You’ll probably end up spending a lot of time here or lounging in the combined living and dining area, which flows nicely thanks to the open layout.

Living and Dining that Balance Style and Practicality

The living room has a comfortable beige sofa with gold and blue cushions, making it a calm spot to relax or entertain. There’s a wall-mounted TV and tasteful décor including gold-accented panels and art on the walls—nothing too flashy, just elegant. The dining area features a sleek marble table set for four, complemented by crystal glassware and gold-accented plates, perfect for both casual meals and small dinners.

Modern Kitchen with Smart Storage

In the kitchen you’ll find glossy beige cabinets, an L-shaped design that maximizes counter space, and top-notch finishes like a modern black faucet and under-mount sink. It’s clean, modern, and highly functional, with integrated appliances and plenty of storage, so you don’t feel cluttered if you like to cook.

Overall, this resale condo offers a great combination of natural light, well-thought-out design, and practical living spaces—all freehold too, which is a big plus here in Bangkok.

property_description:
Sindhorn Tonson, an ultra-luxury condominium located right by Lumpini Park. This spacious unit on the 14th floor offers 87 sq.m. with 1 bedroom and 1 bathroom, featuring a ceiling height of 3 meters and full-height corner glass windows with stunning city views. The interior is fully furnished with world-class brands, including a Gaggenau kitchen, Kuppersbusch refrigerator, and Poggenpohl built-in system. The bedroom comes with a Poliform walk-in closet imported from Italy, while the bathroom is finished with marble, a freestanding Villeroy & Boch bathtub, and a TOTO Neorest. Flooring combines parquet and marble throughout, adding elegance and sophistication.

Residents enjoy ultra-luxury facilities and thoughtful design, including single-load corridor privacy, a marble-clad lobby, fitness center, swimming pool, and 24-hour security. The project also provides a private shuttle bus service to Velaa and Mercury Ville for maximum convenience.

Located in the prestigious Langsuan area, right next to Lumpini Park, the residence offers an exclusive lifestyle in the heart of Bangkok’s most sought-after neighborhood. It is surrounded by luxury malls, fine dining, embassies, and top-tier hotels, making it the perfect choice for refined urban living.

property_description:
Penthouse in Central Phrom Phong

This 388 sqm condo offers three bedrooms and four bathrooms, so it's perfect if you want plenty of space and privacy for everyone. The bedrooms feel generous and well-lit, thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows with horizontal blinds that let in natural light but also offer control over your privacy.

Indoor Meets Outdoor

One of the standout features is the outdoor dining area. It’s got a charming wooden dining table with six matching chairs, nestled among lush greenery and several trees. The patio, enclosed by low concrete walls and featuring concrete flooring, creates a peaceful and private outdoor spot right at home. There's even a small adjoining shed for extra storage or flexibility.

Elegant, Practical Finishes

Inside, the design uses a neutral palette, mixing dark marble with white veining and warm wood textures, which gives it a refined yet inviting feel. The bathrooms are especially impressive: think freestanding round white bathtubs with gold faucets, large marble tiles, floating vanities, and clever recessed lighting. The master bath has a classy glass partition and backlit mirrors that make the space feel modern but serene.

Overall, this place balances luxury, comfort, and privacy in a bustling Bangkok neighborhood—definitely worth seeing if you want something spacious with a great indoor-outdoor flow.

property_description:
This spacious 142 sq.m. corner unit on a high floor comes with a rare 33 sq.m. wide balcony, offering panoramic views of Bangkok with no obstructions. The unit features 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom with a Jacuzzi and hot water massage system, plus a large living room, oversized kitchen with 2 electric stoves, and complete appliances including refrigerator, washing machine, microwave, TVs, and air conditioners. Fully furnished and move-in ready. Fixed private parking included.

Facilities at Supalai Place Sukhumvit 39 include a large saltwater swimming pool, children’s pool, oversized fitness center, sauna, squash courts, yoga room, table tennis room, garden, BBQ area, playground, shops, and restaurants. The project also offers ample parking, CCTV, keycard access, and 24-hour security.

Located just a 1-minute walk to UFM Fuji Supermarket and 2 minutes to 7-Eleven, the residence is surrounded by amenities such as Ozono Mall, Market Place Thonglor, Rain Hill, Park Lane Ekamai, and leading international schools (Bangkok Prep, Ekamai International). The EM District (EmQuartier, Emporium, Emsphere) and Terminal 21 are also nearby.

property_description:
Open, bright, and thoughtfully laid out living space

This 131 sqm condo really makes great use of its open-plan design, combining the living and dining areas so you’ll probably spend most of your time here. The large floor-to-ceiling windows flood the space with natural light, and with sheer curtains, you can adjust the atmosphere without losing that cityscape view that stretches out beyond.

Comfort meets style

You'll find a light-colored sectional sofa with cushions, perfect for relaxing or hosting. The adjacent dining area is elegantly set with a glossy black table with gold legs, seating six comfortably—nice for dinners with friends or family. A modern chandelier adds just the right touch above the dining table without being too flashy.

Kitchen and bedrooms

The kitchen is sleek and minimalist, featuring built-in appliances and a white island countertop with a built-in sink, plus under-cabinet lighting for a practical yet stylish workspace. Ample storage includes tall cabinets and a double-door stainless steel fridge. Bedrooms maintain that spacious feel, especially the master with floor-to-ceiling windows and heavy drapes for privacy and light control. The neutral colors and polished floors throughout keep things feeling clean and contemporary.

All in all, it’s a well-maintained, elegant home that balances modern touches with comfortable living—definitely worth seeing if you want something ready to move into in the heart of Watthana.

property_description:
Feel right at home in this thoughtfully designed 2-bedroom condo in Khlong Tan Nuea.

The open-plan layout really makes the most of the 72 sqm space, with the living room, dining area, and kitchen flowing seamlessly together. Large floor-to-ceiling windows bring in lots of natural light and give you a great cityscape view, perfect for relaxing evenings or entertaining friends.

The living area is comfortably furnished with a gray upholstered sofa and armchair, anchored by a soft area rug that adds warmth to the neutral-toned tile floor. The dining space is genuinely inviting, featuring a marble table set with six green upholstered chairs and contemporary pendant lighting that adds a bit of style without feeling over the top.

In the kitchen, you’ll appreciate the modern touches like under-cabinet lighting, white countertops, and dark cabinetry, plus integrated appliances that keep everything sleek and uncluttered. Storage’s handled nicely with built-in shelves filled with books and decorative pieces, and there’s even a secure entry door near the kitchen, which adds a practical touch.

Both bedrooms come with their own bathrooms, so privacy isn’t an issue, and the overall minimalist design with clean lines and subtle wood paneling with illuminated black marble accents keeps the space feeling contemporary and polished.

property_description:
Chill in a Contemporary, Light-Filled Space

This 45 sqm condo has a really easy, open feel—especially with those large floor-to-ceiling windows that let in tons of natural light while giving you a nice cityscape view. You’ll probably spend most of your time in the open-plan living and dining area, which strikes a great balance between cozy and stylish. The room features a comfy white sofa paired with a gray armchair, plus patterned throws and soft rugs that make the space feel inviting without being fussy.

Thoughtful Details That Make a Difference

It’s all designed with a neutral palette—mostly gray, white, and beige tones—so it feels modern but timeless. I like the marble accent wall and the vertical lighting, which add personality without overwhelming the space. Built-in shelving with accent lighting gives you a nice spot to show off decor or books, and the recessed ceiling and chandelier lighting create a warm ambiance at night.

The glass-top dining table seats four comfortably, perfect if you like to entertain or just want a good dinner spot with a view. Curtains include both sheer and blackout options, so you can control the light however you want.

Overall, this condo offers a practical, stylish home with freehold ownership right in the heart of Khlong Tan Nuea. It’s move-in ready and feels both airy and intimate at the same time.

property_description:
Welcome to a light-filled, modern condo in Thonglor

This two-bedroom, two-bath unit’s layout really flows well—you’ll probably spend most of your time in the spacious living room where floor-to-ceiling windows open up to panoramic city skyline views. The natural light here is excellent, softened by sheer curtains and balanced by a warm floor lamp you can adjust in the evenings.

Comfort meets style

The living area is thoughtfully put together with a light-colored curved sofa and an armchair arranged around a large round coffee table, resting on a soft textured rug that adds a cozy touch. The dining area fits six comfortably under an elegant chandelier with globe lights, perfect for both casual meals and entertaining.

The bedrooms continue the minimalist, modern vibe—neutral tones, clean lines, and subtle modern wall art. The master has a large upholstered bed with a headboard, two bedside tables with sleek lamps, and a chaise lounge chair by big windows. There’s plenty of storage too, thanks to built-in wardrobes with sliding doors.

If you value natural light, city views, and a calm, uncluttered space, this freehold condo in Watthana is definitely worth seeing in person.

property_description:
This one-bedroom condo offers a smart, open layout that makes the most of its 55 sqm. You’ll likely spend a lot of time in the living and dining area, where large floor-to-ceiling windows let in plenty of natural light and frame a nice cityscape view – perfect for relaxing or entertaining.

The space feels fresh and modern, with minimalist, neutral-toned furniture that keeps things feeling uncluttered and calm. The living area comes ready with a comfortable sofa, coffee table, and a wall-mounted TV, while the dining table with chairs fits nicely without crowding the room.

In the bedroom, the upholstered bed with white bedding looks inviting, and the bedside tables with lamps add a cozy touch. A room divider subtly separates the sleeping area, and there’s a small desk with a chair if you need a dedicated spot to work or study. Wooden and laminate flooring throughout adds warmth, and the mix of pendant and floor lamps creates layered lighting for different moods. Sheer drapes and curtains give flexibility between light and privacy.

Owned freehold, this unit is ready to move in and suits anyone looking for a practical, stylish city pad in Watthana.

property_description:
Bright and Airy Living in the Heart of Watthana

This 91 sqm condo is seriously well laid out—two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a nice open feel thanks to those large floor-to-ceiling windows that flood the space with natural light. You’ll probably spend most of your time in the main bedroom, which is spacious and comes with a walk-in closet equipped with glass-front cabinets and interior lighting, so organizing your wardrobe will be a breeze.

The design is modern but comfy, with warm wooden floors and neutral, earthy tones that make the whole place feel calm and balanced. There’s a marble-topped desk area with a white cushioned chair, perfect for working from home or just catching up on your emails.

Highlights include recessed ceiling lights, layered bedding with a padded headboard, and clever built-in shelves and storage solutions that keep everything clutter-free. The vanity table with its large mirror and decorative lighting is a nice touch if you like a dedicated space to get ready.

It’s offplan right now, so there’s a fresh feel to it—freehold ownership is a bonus in this area. If you want contemporary style with practical features and lots of natural light in a lively neighborhood, this one’s worth seeing.

Natural light filters through curtains softly, and recessed ceiling lights bring a cozy ambiance at night. You’ll also find a glass partition that helps separate spaces without cutting off light or flow. Overall, it’s a practical yet stylish place that feels inviting and easy to live in.

Modern Kitchen and Dining

The bedroom fits both a queen and a king-size bed (which is a bit unusual and suggests flexible sleeping options). The soft headboard and multiple pillows give a very inviting, comfortable vibe, while two warm bedside lamps keep things cozy at night. A large mirror on the wall and a partition with frosted glass help define the space without closing it off.

The modern kitchen stands out with white cabinetry and sleek integrated appliances—all backed by a striking black backsplash. It’s compact but definitely practical. Right next to it is a dining table with four chairs and a nice pendant lighting setup, ready for anything from quick breakfasts to small dinner gatherings.

Natural Light and Finishes

One of the highlights is the large window with curtains and a cushioned window seat that’s perfect for morning coffee or reading. The hardwood floors and recessed ceiling lights tie the whole space together with a clean, contemporary feel. Overall, the neutral and pastel tones with a colorful geometric accent wall keep the place feeling fresh and modern.

You’ll probably spend most of your time here in the combination living/dining/kitchen area since it’s well laid out and feels open despite the compact size. Being freehold in a desirable Watthana neighborhood adds to its appeal, especially if you want a practical, stylish base in Bangkok.

Reflective surfaces, mirrors, and thoughtful lighting fixtures like recessed and hanging lights keep it bright and airy.

If you want a practical, stylish home in Watthana with freedom of ownership and ready to move into soon, this condo’s worth checking out.

This is a pretty unique find—a high-rise corner unit with floor-to-ceiling windows on two sides, so you get amazing natural light and unobstructed city views all day. At 156 square meters, the layout is open and flexible, but the interior is still in a bare-shell condition. You’ve got this cool industrial vibe with unfinished concrete floors, exposed ceilings showing pipes, ducts, and wiring, and vertical support columns right inside the space.

Because it’s unfinished, it’s a blank canvas—you can turn it into a sleek modern home or even a creative workspace if that’s your thing. There’s sliding glass doors leading out to a balcony, perfect for taking in the skyline or enjoying some fresh air. Also, the unit comes with a modern elevator that opens directly inside, adding privacy and convenience.

Being a penthouse, you also have access to a rooftop terrace that features curved glass railings and greenery, which offers a cool outdoor seating area above the city buzz. If you’re someone who appreciates space, light, and the chance to make a place truly your own, this one’s worth a visit.

Bedrooms and bathroom

You'll appreciate the glass-enclosed shower with rainfall and handheld showerheads, plus a freestanding bathtub that overlooks the city through a big window. Soft LED lighting and contemporary fixtures add a touch of luxury.

Bonus: private elevator access means extra privacy and convenience. All in all, this place checks a lot of boxes if you're looking for a comfortable, modern condo in a lively neighborhood.

A relaxed, modern space with great city vibes

This two-bedroom, one-bath condo sits pretty high up on the 26th floor, so you get these amazing panoramic views of Bangkok’s city lights—especially impressive at dusk. The layout’s open-concept, so your living and dining areas flow nicely together. You’ll probably spend most of your time here, kicking back on the tan leather sofa with some cushions and throws, or dining around a beautiful wooden table that has this unique live-edge design, paired with comfy brown leather chairs. The floor lamp nearby adds soft, warm lighting that makes the space feel cozy in the evenings.

Wood plank flooring runs throughout, giving a warm, natural touch, and neutral wall colors keep everything feeling calm and modern. The kitchen’s sleek and practical, with black glossy upper cabinets and wood lower ones, a built-in electric stove, and neat under-cabinet lighting that brightens the stone-textured backsplash. It’s compact but thoughtfully designed for everyday cooking.

The bedroom’s a real highlight—big windows with blackout curtains, a comfy double bed dressed in crisp white linens, and warm ambient lighting from bedside lamps. Storage’s generous with a dark, sleek wardrobe, and the bathroom feels quite luxe with both a bathtub and a separate rain shower, modern fixtures, and natural beige tiles.

Out on the balcony, you’ve got a small set-up with wireframe chairs and a table—perfect for a quiet morning coffee or winding down while watching the city buzz below. Overall, it’s a great blend of modern comfort and city energy in one, freehold condo.

Overall, it’s a pet-friendly condo that balances clean, modern style with a warm, lived-in feel. If you’re looking for a place that’s move-in ready with thoughtful details and enough space to breathe in the city, this is worth a look.

It’s a duplex layout, so there’s a good sense of separation between living and sleeping areas, which makes it practical if you want a quiet spot to retreat to while still having plenty of room for guests or a home office.

Interior with Modern, Minimalist Vibes

The design leans minimalist but thoughtfully done, with light-colored walls, smooth white surfaces, and natural wood accents that warm things up without feeling busy. The light wooden plank flooring adds to the airy feeling. You’ll likely spend most of your time in the spacious living room, which features a white sofa, black framed armchairs, and chic coffee and side tables—all arranged on a large area rug that anchors the space nicely.

Details That Make a Difference

  • Four bathrooms for convenience with three bedrooms
  • Recessed ambient lighting and wall niches add a soft glow so evenings feel cozy
  • Partition shelving units and indoor-outdoor connections bring flexibility and greenery indoors
  • Offered as bare-shell or fully-fitted, so you can tailor it to your taste

Being freehold in Watthana means it’s a solid long-term investment in one of Bangkok’s vibrant neighborhoods. If you appreciate clean lines, natural light, and a layout that makes everyday living comfortable, this one’s worth checking out.

Modern Living with Thoughtful Details

This 217 sqm condo offers a really comfortable layout, perfect if you want both space and style. You'll probably appreciate the natural light flooding in through the floor-to-ceiling windows, softened by sheer curtains that keep things bright but private.

Living and Kitchen Space

The open-concept kitchen and dining area feel welcoming without being overly large. The kitchen stands out with minimalist white cabinetry, under-cabinet lighting, and integrated appliances including an oven and microwave. The island with a sink is a nice touch for casual meals or prepping, and the dark wood dining table with cushioned chairs gives it a cozy yet refined vibe.

Being freehold and part of a luxury low-rise project means you get something exclusive. Since it’s offplan, you can choose a bare-shell or fully fitted option depending on how much customization you want. This place feels like it balances everyday practicality with a touch of luxury — whether you plan to live here or use it as a boutique office space.

This triple aspect corner unit offers spectacular afternoon sun and sunset, which floods through its primary South/West aspect. This dramatic sunset atop the Royal Sports Club & city skyline can be enjoyed in the main living area or the connected L-shaped spacious balcony, which features a new patinated stucco floor.

The compact kitchen off the main living space features the use of Gaggenau and Siemens, the high-end European appliances which can be fully hidden behind sliding doors.

The newly re-fitted Master Bathroom & Power Room feature European travertine with polished nickel Water Works taps. A sizable 14 new cabinets & closets have been fitted with the spacious walk-in closet, which offers plenty of storage space. All the door handles are European imported with a finishing touch of brass and polished nickel.

property_description:
This spacious 127 sqm condominium on the third floor offers a harmonious blend of practical layout and refined design. The open-plan living and kitchen area creates a fluid sense of space, ideal for both relaxation and entertaining. The living room is furnished with a dark leather sofa and bathed in natural light from expansive sliding glass doors, which open onto a large balcony with sleek metal railings—a perfect spot to enjoy the cityscape or unwind at the end of the day.

The contemporary kitchen features crisp white cabinetry, recessed lighting, and a black countertop island, suitable for casual dining or meal preparation. It is equipped with a double sink, an integrated electric stovetop, a reverse osmosis water system and a tiled backsplash designed for both style and ease of maintenance.

The property comprises two bedrooms and two bathrooms, offering flexibility for families, professionals, or shared living arrangements. Warm wood flooring in the living room contrasts elegantly with light-toned tiles in the kitchen and dining areas, ensuring both comfort and practicality. Built-in cabinets in the dining area contain a stacked Bosch washer and dryer,  as well as integrated space for display or storage.  The hallway and refrigerator alcove contain cabinets specifically designed for shoe storage, suitcases and cleaning equipment. There is a balcony water supply for gardening enthusiasts.

This freehold unit is currently tenant-occupied until Oct 2026, presenting an immediate investment opportunity (with the ability to extend). Situated in the prime Asoke, it is within close proximity to Sukhumvit’s vibrant dining, retail, and lifestyle offerings.

property_description:
Bright, Open-Concept Living with a City View

This 110 sqm condo in Phra Khanong gives you a real sense of space, with three bedrooms and three bathrooms laid out thoughtfully. You’ll probably spend most of your time in the open-plan living and dining area, where floor-to-ceiling windows bring in plenty of natural light and frame those city skyline views beautifully.

Kitchen and Dining Highlights

The kitchen’s designed with practicality and style in mind. It’s a U-shaped layout with modern, matte-finish cabinets in neutral tones and white countertops that feel clean and fresh. You’ve got built-in appliances like an electric stovetop, microwave, and even an under-counter washing machine—which you don’t see in every unit. Recessed and under-cabinet lighting brighten the space while a marble-style backsplash and a wine rack add subtle touches of elegance. The glass dining table with upholstered chairs makes for a cozy spot to enjoy meals.

Comfort and Style in the Bedrooms

The master bedroom is generous in size and feels calm with a padded accent wall behind the king-size bed and soft, neutral tones throughout. A walk-in closet with glass sliding doors keeps everything organized and there’s a sleek vanity with backlit mirror if you like to get ready in comfort. The en-suite features a glass shower, rainfall showerhead, and a built-in bathtub, all designed to be both practical and modern.

Wood laminate floors throughout add warmth, and you'll find nice touches like elegant lighting fixtures, decorative plants, and reflective surfaces that help expand the space visually. Overall, it’s a well-thought-out home that’s move-in ready and freehold, which is always a plus for long-term buyers.

property_description:
A compact but thoughtfully designed space

This 35 sqm condo in Phra Khanong feels way bigger than it is, thanks to the open-plan living and dining area combined with floor-to-ceiling windows that bring in plenty of natural light and offer a great city view. You’ll probably spend most of your time here—the marble accent wall with integrated lighting and the modern sofa make it a comfortable, stylish spot to unwind.

Smart separation between living and sleeping

Instead of a traditional door, there’s a sliding glass partition between the living room and the bedroom. It gives you privacy without closing off the light or space. The bedroom itself feels cozy with a double bed, blackout curtains, and a walk-in closet with glass-front cabinets illuminated from within, so finding clothes is a breeze.

Modern touches throughout

  • Wooden flooring and an area rug add warmth
  • Ceiling recessed and ambient lighting create a soft, inviting atmosphere
  • AIR conditioning units in both living and bedroom areas keep things cool
  • Glass-enclosed shower area in the bathroom is sleek and easy to maintain

All in all, this place blends modern convenience and smart use of space, perfect if you want an easy-to-live-in, low-maintenance home with a nice view right in the heart of Bangkok.

property_description:
Compact but Thoughtfully Designed

This 31 sqm condo is a great fit if you're looking for something modern and easy to maintain in the heart of Bangkok's Phra Khanong area. The open-plan layout means you don't feel cramped—the kitchen, living, and sleeping areas flow nicely into one another, yet the sliding glass doors give you some separation when you want it.

Kitchen and Living

The kitchen is surprisingly well-equipped for its size, with sleek cabinetry, an induction cooktop, built-in microwave, and handy overhead vent hood—all the essentials for cooking at home. Right next to it is a cozy laundry space with a washing machine and storage shelves above, which keeps things convenient but hidden.

Comfort and Style

Wood floors and recessed ceiling lights give the place a warm, modern feel. The living area has a sofa and a small dining table with a tasteful glass or marble top and gold legs—nice touches that show attention to detail. Large windows flood the room with natural light and offer views of the bustling city skyline, which you’ll appreciate especially in the evenings.

The bathroom feels quite polished with its glass shower door and wall-mounted vanity. There's even built-in shelving and a dark gray wardrobe with reflective doors to maximize storage without feeling bulky. Plus, the air-con unit mounted above the bed ensures you'll stay cool year-round.

All in all, this feels like a smart, move-in-ready spot if you want to be close to city conveniences without compromising on style or practicality.

property_description:
Step Inside This Open and Airy Duplex

This 3-bedroom, 3-bath condo in Khlong Tan Nuea really makes the most of natural light thanks to those floor-to-ceiling windows in the open-plan living area. You’ll probably spend most of your time here, especially with the sliding glass doors opening onto a spacious balcony that offers clear city views—perfect for relaxing or entertaining.

The layout feels modern and fresh with a sleek U-shaped kitchen featuring white marble countertops, plenty of storage, and a built-in oven. The kitchen island with drawers is not only practical but also helps create a smooth flow between cooking and the living space.

Design Details Worth Noting

  • The high ceilings and recessed lighting add a clean, contemporary feel without being over the top.
  • Polished marble-like tile flooring on the main floor contrasts nicely with dark wood upstairs, giving each level its own character.
  • The modern staircase with a glass railing adds an elegant touch while keeping things open and airy.

Bathrooms echo the condo’s modern vibe—with wall-mounted mirrors, black marble countertops, and a freestanding bathtub placed next to a large window, so you can soak in natural light.

Since it’s a freehold property, it’s a solid investment, and the quiet yet central location in Watthana means you’re never far from everything Bangkok has to offer.

property_description:
Welcome to this practical yet stylish 2-bedroom condo in Khlong Toei.

At 52 sqm, it’s got a nice open-plan layout that really helps the space feel bigger—perfect if you like having room to move without feeling lost. The wooden floors throughout add warmth, and you’ll probably spend a lot of time in the spacious living area, which looks out onto a peaceful garden view. That kind of natural light streaming in through the large windows really lifts the whole place.

The dining area is simple but elegant, featuring a glass-topped round table with an eye-catching metal base, paired with four comfy upholstered chairs trimmed with subtle nailhead details. It’s an easy spot for dinner or even working from home.

Storage’s thoughtfully done with a built-in white cabinet and open shelves that blend functionality and style. The bedrooms come with neutral palettes and built-in headboards, bedside lamps, plus soft decorative touches like pillows and a rug to make it feel cozy. You’ll find air conditioning units above the windows to keep things cool.

Overall, it’s a bright, contemporary space with a relaxed vibe and practical features—ideal if you want something move-in ready with good natural light and that little bit of extra elegance without going over the top.

Easy Living in Khlong Toei

This one-bedroom condo is about 33 sqm, offering a simple, open-plan layout that feels comfortable without being cramped. You’ll probably spend most of your time in the bedroom area, which is surprisingly spacious and bright thanks to a large window overlooking some garden greenery — not something you see every day in the city.

The decor leans modern minimalist with a nice balance of warm wood tones and neutral colors, including wood laminate floors and a subtle wood-paneled accent wall behind the bed. The queen or king-sized bed with its tufted headboard looks inviting, and the little details like the bedside table and stylish lamp make it feel like a real home.

The living area has a comfortable beige sofa and a glass coffee table, making it easy to relax or entertain a friend. The small but well-thought-out kitchen and bathroom keep things practical — the bathroom has a glass partition shower and wood cabinetry that matches the overall clean, modern vibe.

Air conditioning is included, which you'll appreciate in Bangkok, and the overall feel is quiet, bright, and ready to move into. Perfect if you want a low-maintenance, nicely finished place in a central area with freehold ownership.

Residents have access to a range of facilities including a swimming pool, fitness center, and 24-hour security, ensuring a convenient and safe lifestyle.

Light-filled Loft-Style Living in the Heart of Bangkok

This offplan condo is all about space and style, sitting high up with only four units per floor, so you get a real sense of privacy. The loft-style layout is open and airy, anchored by floor-to-ceiling windows that bring in a ton of natural light and offer panoramic views of the city skyline—definitely a spot where you’ll want to relax and unwind after a long day.

Comfort and Practicality

You've got three bedrooms and two bathrooms, making it practical for families or anyone needing a bit of extra room. The large bed in the master feels inviting with soft pink and pastel bedding, layered pillows, and subtle wall art adding a cozy touch. The neutral color palette with beige, browns, and soft grays gives the whole place a calm, modern vibe.

The living area flows nicely, featuring a big beige sectional sofa, a dark wood accent wall with marble paneling, and built-in TV console—all quite sleek but still warm thanks to wooden flooring and well-chosen lighting.

Kitchen and Storage

The kitchen stands out with dark wood cabinetry contrasted by a light marble backsplash and under-cabinet lights, plus a stainless steel sink and modern faucet. Storage’s smartly handled with a glass-fronted closet framed in black, keeping everything feeling tidy and upscale.

Overall, this unit blends practical living with thoughtful design and a real feeling of calm above the city's energy. It’s freehold, so it’s a solid long-term investment if you’re looking in Watthana.

The living room's probably where you’ll spend most of your downtime. It’s modern but cozy, with a beige sectional sofa perfectly placed to face a wall-mounted flat screen TV set against a marble accent wall—adds a touch of luxury without feeling cold. Dark wood paneling on the walls and wooden flooring keep things warm, while the ambient ceiling lighting and those large windows with sheer curtains fill the room with a soft, natural light.

The kitchen is sleek and practical, featuring an L-shaped layout with dark wood, handleless cabinets and a light, solid surface countertop that’s easy to clean. Under-cabinet lighting brightens the prep space, and you’ve got all the essentials like a built-in induction cooktop and a stainless steel microwave seamlessly integrated into the cabinetry.

Both bedrooms are well-sized, with the master offering a walk-in closet that’s a real highlight—built-in shelving, integrated LED lights, and plenty of hanging space make organization a breeze. There’s even a vanity area with a round mirror and recessed lighting. The bathroom is modern, with a glass-enclosed shower, bidet toilet with controls, and sleek fixtures.

This offplan unit is freehold, so you’re set to move in or rent out as you please. It’s a great blend of style and function if you want something contemporary in a lively Bangkok neighborhood.

Under-cabinet lighting and a couple of pendant lights over the breakfast bar add a nice touch, making it great for casual meals or morning coffee.

The kitchen also has built-in appliances like a stovetop and microwave, plus a small coffee machine, so you can actually use the space without feeling cramped. The breakfast bar seats two brown leather chairs comfortably, which fits nicely with the minimalist vibe you’ll see throughout.

The living area has wooden flooring, a white upholstered sofa with plenty of decorative pillows, and a large flat-screen TV mounted on a wood-paneled wall with a dark marble console underneath. Floor-to-ceiling windows bring in plenty of natural light and are dressed with both sheer and blackout curtains to control the mood.

Both bedrooms have ample space, and the bathrooms carry that same contemporary feel, including a vanity with metallic gold front panels and a glass-enclosed shower with frameless doors. Overall, the design is clean and contemporary but still warm and inviting. The dark entrance door near the kitchen adds a subtle contrast that grounds the space nicely.

One Bedroom, One Bath – Perfect for City Living

This 41 sqm condo feels thoughtfully designed, especially if you prefer an open, airy space that’s easy to maintain. The living area, with its contemporary vibe, features a comfortable white sofa facing a wall-mounted TV, while the large floor-to-ceiling windows flood the room with natural light and offer nice views.

Kitchen That Makes Cooking Enjoyable

The kitchen is surprisingly well-equipped and stylish—a real highlight here. Dark wood cabinets paired with white quartz countertops give it a sleek look, and you’ll find built-in appliances like a stovetop and microwave. The under-cabinet lighting and pendant lights above the breakfast bar add a subtle, cozy touch. Plus, there’s seating for two on leather-upholstered chairs, so it’s just the right size for casual meals or coffee breaks.

Rest and Relax

The bedroom fits a king-size bed comfortably and features a walk-in shower that feels modern and airy. The overall neutral, light flooring keeps things bright and helps the space feel bigger than it is. Built-in shelving and decorative touches like artwork and a wooden accent wall add character without clutter.

With freehold ownership and being off-plan, this place could be an excellent investment or a stylish home base in the lively Khlong Toei Nuea area.

property_description:
Let me walk you through this one-bedroom condo in Khlong Toei Nuea — it’s a solid choice if you’re after something modern, manageable in size, and with a freehold title.

The interior is about 31 sqm, so it’s cozy but smartly laid out. You’ve got a large floor-to-ceiling window in the bedroom, which means plenty of natural light and good ventilation. The sheer curtains give you privacy without blocking the light, and the darker drapes help when you want to shut things out.

The living area feels modern and inviting. There’s a white sofa complemented by colorful cushions, sitting on a soft rug laid over wooden flooring. It all has this fresh, comfortable vibe—plus the abstract wall art adds some personality without overwhelming the space. The glass sliding door to the balcony (or maybe another area) keeps the natural light flowing, which is great in a condo of this size.

The bathroom is thoughtfully designed with neutral tones, marble floor tiles with subtle grey veining, and a sleek, wall-mounted vanity with black and gold details. You get a rainfall shower with a glass enclosure and recessed shelves, along with quality touches like a white ceramic toilet with integrated bidet controls. There’s even a cushioned stool by the vanity with a large round mirror framed in gold—nice little luxury for a compact space.

Overall, it’s clean, elegant, and quite practical for city living. The finishes and lighting give it a bit of character without feeling too flashy. If you want something offplan where every detail feels considered, this one is worth a look.

You’ll probably spend most of your time in the living area, which gets plenty of natural light thanks to floor-to-ceiling curtains. The white sofa with decorative pillows and sleek wood flooring create a warm, inviting spot to relax or entertain.

The design leans modern with touches that add a bit of luxury, like marble flooring with light gray veining and gold accents on furniture pieces — think the legs of the white cushioned vanity stool and the console table. Art lovers will appreciate the abstract framed artwork and the thoughtful decorative touches, like plants and a stylish Marshall speaker for great sound.

The bathroom feels fresh and clean with beige tiles, a modern white sink, and a rain shower with both handheld and rainfall heads. Storage is smartly integrated with under-sink cabinets accented by black handles and gold trim.

Overall, this place has a polished but comfortable vibe, perfect if you want a tastefully finished home in Watthana with freehold ownership. Being offplan means you can look forward to new, never-lived-in condition when it’s ready.

A true mansion in the sky on the 37th floor

This place is rare—1400 sqm of space, so much bigger than your usual Bangkok condo. You get four bedrooms and three bathrooms laid out over a unit that feels more like a low-rise home vertically stacked. The high ceilings and large windows flood the living area with natural light, making it the spot you'll probably spend most of your time.

One of the standout features is the large wooden staircase with modern metal handrails connecting the mezzanine, which adds a real architectural wow-factor alongside the wooden paneling and glossy wooden floors. The seating area is cozy yet sophisticated, complete with a glass coffee table and plenty of space for indoor plants, creating a homey yet contemporary vibe.

There are multiple balconies running around the unit with glass railings, offering 360-degree views of Bangkok—perfect for morning coffee or evening sunsets. For relaxing, the built-in jacuzzi bathtub with skylight makes a great retreat. The unit also comes with some impressive extras like a private swimming pool, gym, and even a cinema room, plus four private elevators which is super convenient.

It’s a resale and will need some updating, but for a buyer wanting expansive space and privacy in the heart of Sathon, this is a rare opportunity.

Unique Penthouse Central Phrom Phong

This is a sizable 444 sqm condo sitting on the 30th floor, with four bedrooms and four bathrooms, perfect if you want plenty of room to spread out or host guests. The open-plan living and dining area is really the heart of the home — with floor-to-ceiling windows and large folding glass doors leading to a beautifully curved balcony. You’ll probably spend a lot of time here, especially as the panoramic city views come alive at dusk.

Design and Feel

The overall vibe is modern minimalist with a clean, neutral palette—think white walls, light wood flooring, and smooth, polished surfaces. Built-in wooden closets and work desks blend seamlessly into the space, keeping things clutter-free. The curved walls, arched doorways, and ceiling recesses add subtle architectural interest without feeling overwhelming.

Practical Features

There’s a balcony or ledge area you can access, plus a spacious rooftop terrace with glass safety railings—great for outdoor seating or entertaining with that amazing urban backdrop. Also, you can actually see some green spaces from here, which is a nice break for a high-rise spot.

With a potential 4 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms, plus 4 parking spaces, this freehold resale unit is perfect if you want to create a custom luxury home or an impressive executive condo right in the heart of Thung Mahamek. Bright and Open Living on the 30th Floor

This 96 sqm condo really makes the most of its height and location. The large floor-to-ceiling windows bring in tons of natural light and frame some impressive Bangkok city views, especially from the living room and balcony. You’ll probably spend most of your time here, relaxing on the comfy dark gray sectional sofa surrounded by subtle, modern decor and tasteful artwork.

Functional Layout with a Fresh Feel

The open-plan living and dining area flows well, making it feel spacious rather than cramped. The dining spot has a sleek glass table with four black chairs—a nice touch if you like hosting small dinners. The light-colored tile and hardwood floors throughout keep things bright, balanced by the neutral wall colors and minimalist decorations that help the space feel calm and uncluttered.

Comfortable Bedrooms with Thoughtful Details

There are two bedrooms, both designed with comfort in mind. The master features a modern double bed dressed in dark gray bedding with textured blankets, flanked by artworks and a cozy nightstand setup. Roman blinds and sheer curtains give you control over light without sacrificing the view or privacy.

Overall, it’s a solid resale option if you want a well-kept, freehold condo in Watthana that combines practical living with those unbeatable city views.

A rare 473 sqm duplex penthouse in the heart of Thonglor, blending striking architecture with lush greenery for a true indoor–outdoor living experience. Wrapped in balconies and floor-to-ceiling glass, the home offers panoramic skyline views and abundant natural light.

Highlights include a double-height living room, open-plan kitchen with green granite island, multiple en suite bedrooms, and a master suite with walk-in closet, resort-style bathroom, private sky garden, and outdoor jacuzzi. The upper gallery provides flexible space for an office or lounge, while design features such as an L-shaped illuminated staircase, hidden guest room door, and cascading plants create a unique atmosphere.

Smart home technology, 2 fixed parking spaces, access to pool and gym, plus a separate maid’s area complete this one-of-a-kind urban retreat.

A mezzanine houses a library and office (convertible to a bedroom), while the master suite includes a walk-in closet and ensuite. Additional rooms include a detached studio with ensuite, ideal for guests, gym, or staff quarters. Smart home tech, 4 fixed parking spaces, balcony with greenery, and access to 3 pools and a gym complete the package.

Pet-friendly and foreign quota eligible.

Step into a Bright and Airy Space on the 10th Floor

This 2-bedroom, 3-bath condo offers a practical, modern layout that really feels like home. You’ll find the bedrooms quite spacious — the master has a large bed against a dark grey accent wall and plenty of natural light from a big window with sheer and patterned curtains. The bedside tables have storage for your books or essentials, which is a nice touch.

Open-Plan Living That Works

The living, dining, and kitchen areas flow together seamlessly, highlighted by floor-to-ceiling windows that flood the space with daylight and open up to a decent-sized balcony. It’s a great spot for morning coffee or just hanging out with city views. The hardwood floors and clean, minimalist interior keep things feeling fresh without any clutter.

  • Modern kitchen features an island with a built-in stove and a narrow layout that’s efficient.
  • Dining table comfortably seats six—ideal if you enjoy entertaining.
  • Comfortable sectional sofa with cushions and even floor seating options.

Outdoor Space and Views

The balcony is spacious with terracotta tiles and plenty of greenery, including potted plants and flowering greenery integrated into the railing. Outdoor seating and a wooden sunbed make this a real extension of your living space, complete with a high-rise cityscape backdrop that's especially striking at night.

Being freehold in Watthana and located in the multi-story, modern Sukhumvit House building with clear signage and tall palm trees outside offers both convenience and style.

property_description:
Feels bright and open, with great use of space

This is a solid resale condo on the 25th floor, offering three bedrooms and three bathrooms—perfect if you want space for family or guests. The layout really opens up in the living and dining areas, where the floor-to-ceiling windows flood the space with natural light and give you those classic Bangkok city skyline views, including some nice green patches nearby.

Details that make daily life easier

Wooden flooring runs throughout, adding warmth, while recessed ceiling lights keep everything softly lit in the evening. You’ll likely spend most of your time here: the living room is comfy with a modern sectional sofa, cushions, and a TV mounted on the wall, plus a rug that ties it all together. The dining area features a large wooden table with enough chairs for dinner parties, and the kitchen is well-equipped with white cabinetry, a built-in oven, electric stove, and black countertops.

Private and practical spaces

The bedrooms are spacious, with sizable windows letting in light and views. A walk-in closet with multiple rods and drawers adds smart storage, while bathrooms have sleek fixtures and a mix of shower and bathtub options. There’s also a handy storage room with racks—ideal for shoes or even your golf bag.

Extra perks

  • Balcony access with metal railings and city views
  • Air conditioning units throughout
  • Neutral, calming wall colors enhanced by indoor plants
  • Soft textiles and tasteful decorative touches that make it feel like home

All in all, it’s a comfortable, stylish spot that offers both city energy and some peaceful pockets. Definitely worth a look if you want a roomy, practical base in Khlong Toei.

property_description:
Thoughtfully laid out with plenty of natural light

This condo really feels roomy with 141 sqm to spread out in, and the large floor-to-ceiling windows let in amazing natural light throughout the day. You’ll probably spend most of your time in the spacious living room, which comes with a comfy beige upholstered sofa and a glass-top coffee table that even has storage underneath — perfect for keeping things tidy.

The open-plan layout flows seamlessly from the living area into the dining and kitchen space. The dining table seats eight comfortably, so it’s great if you like having friends or family over. You’ll notice the modern, wood-finished kitchen is super practical, stocked with built-in appliances including a double oven and microwave, plus a stainless steel refrigerator. Cooking at the kitchen island with a cooktop and range hood feels really sleek, surrounded by clean white surfaces and under-cabinet lighting that keeps the whole space bright.

A smart mix of style and function

There’s even a cozy office nook with a padded wall panel behind the desk, perfect if you need to work from home. Neutral tones and glossy tiled floors throughout keep the vibe calm and contemporary, while recessed ceiling lights and a modern chandelier add just the right touch of warmth. Sliding doors separate the bedroom and bathroom, giving you privacy without closing off the light and flow.

Up on the 18th floor, this freehold unit offers both a practical layout and a comfortable, modern feel right in the heart of Watthana, Khlong Toei Nuea. Definitely worth a look if you value space and natural light in Bangkok.

property_description:
Easy Living in Khlong Toei

This 1-bedroom, 2-bath condo on the 6th floor is a solid find if you want a comfortable, freehold space in central Bangkok. The layout is open and airy, with the living and dining areas flowing together — you’ll probably spend most of your time here. The light wood floors and neutral walls keep the atmosphere calm and easy to style.

Practical Kitchen and Living

The kitchen is a smart use of space, with white cabinets and a sleek black granite countertop. It’s compact but fully functional, with a built-in two-burner cooktop and plenty of storage underneath. There’s also a fridge conveniently close by, making it simple to cook up something quick or enjoy a meal at the dining table, which doubles well as a workspace. Large windows and sliding glass doors open onto the balcony, flooding the room with natural light.

Balcony & Views

The balcony has space to relax and take in city views — a mix of green trees and surrounding mid- to high-rise buildings. It feels surprisingly peaceful up here and gives you a nice outdoor spot without leaving your home. With two bathrooms and thoughtful built-in storage, this unit balances style and everyday convenience well.

property_description:
Pet Friendly condo in a Central Location 

This 155 sqm unit on the 28th floor really makes the most of its space with two bedrooms and three bathrooms, which is pretty convenient if you have guests or a small family. The layout is open and minimalist, so you won’t feel cramped, and the large floor-to-ceiling windows sliding out to the balcony bring in lots of natural light plus fantastic cityscape views.

Comfort meets style

You’ll probably spend a lot of time in the living area, which has a nice leather sectional sofa right by a wall-mounted flat-screen TV and a cool gray brick accent wall. The wooden floors have a glossy finish that gives the place a polished look without feeling too cold. The ceiling fan with multiple blades keeps things comfortable without relying solely on AC.

Home bar and kitchen highlights

If you like to entertain, the built-in bar area stands out with its black marble countertop, glass cabinets stocked for drinks, an industrial-style hanging light fixture, and even a mini fridge underneath. The kitchen island with dual sinks, a built-in cooktop, oven, and a charming blue-and-white decorative backsplash make food prep easy and enjoyable.

Overall, this place blends city living with a functional, stylish setup — perfect if you want a sleek home that feels welcoming and a little unique.

property_description:
Bright, Open Living with Stunning Views

This 183 sqm condo feels really open and airy, mainly thanks to the large floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors in the living room that flood the space with natural light. You’ll likely spend a lot of time here, especially with the black leather sectional sofa and extra futon providing plenty of spots to relax or entertain. The polished hardwood floors and neutral walls make the space feel warm and inviting without being over the top.

Balcony and Outdoors

The balcony is a real highlight: wooden flooring, glass and metal railings, a ceiling fan, and enough room for outdoor seating. From up here on the 18th floor, you get a panoramic view not only of the bustling Bangkok cityscape but also of a lovely green park with walking paths and a lake. It’s a rare blend of urban energy and nature, all visible from your home.

Kitchen and Work Space

The kitchen flows straight into the living and dining areas, featuring a sleek black granite island topped with two modern pendant lights. White cabinetry and stainless steel appliances keep it looking modern and clean. Plus, there’s a dedicated workstation by the window—great if you need to work from home or study with natural light coming in.

All in all, this is a practical, stylish place with a great layout and some genuinely peaceful views, right in the heart of Khlong Toei.

property_description:
Spacious 2-Bedroom Condo with Panoramic Views

This unit on the 39th floor really stands out if you’re looking for a bright, airy space. The open-concept layout combines the living area and kitchen seamlessly, so you’ll probably spend most of your time here. Floor-to-ceiling windows flood the room with natural light and open up to a balcony with glass railings, giving you unobstructed views of Bangkok’s skyline.

Living and Kitchen Areas

The living room feels comfy with its neutral tones and a sectional sofa that's perfect for relaxing or entertaining. There’s a wall-mounted flat screen TV and light-colored curtains that you can draw for privacy or to control the light. The kitchen, right next to the living area, has a modern minimalist vibe with glossy white countertops and built-in appliances. The large island doubles as a breakfast bar, complete with two bar stools—good for quick meals or chatting while you cook.

Bedrooms and Bathrooms

The master bedroom is inviting with a large padded headboard, nightstands, and an ottoman bench at the foot of the bed. You’ll find a glass partition separating the bedroom from the bathroom, adding a contemporary touch while keeping things light and open. The bathroom includes a freestanding bathtub—nice for unwinding after a long day. The wardrobe features frosted glass with a black frame, tying into the condo’s sleek, modern style.

Overall, it’s a well-thought-out space with high ceilings and quality finishes, perfect for anyone wanting a stylish, comfortable home with fantastic views right in the heart of Watthana.

property_description:
Comfortable, Light-Filled Living

This 85 sqm condo on the 19th floor offers a nicely laid-out open-plan living and dining area that’s really the heart of the home. You’ll probably spend most of your time here—the floor-to-ceiling windows bring in loads of natural light, and the neutral tones with wood-look flooring create a warm and inviting vibe. There’s a large beige sofa perfect for relaxing in front of the built-in entertainment unit with a big flat-screen TV, plus a round coffee table and plush rug that nicely soften the space.

Functional Kitchen and Dining

The kitchen is modern yet approachable, featuring a kitchen island with two black bar stools, plus wooden and white cabinetry that keeps it fresh and clean. Polished stone tiles on the floors add a slightly luxe feel while being practical. The marble dining table seats four comfortably with upholstered chairs, making it great for hosting or casual meals.

Bay-View Balcony & Bedrooms

The balcony has wooden decking, a nice spot to step out and enjoy some fresh air with views of the surrounding commercial buildings—not the busiest, but enough to feel connected to the city. The king-sized bedroom feels restful and uncluttered with a gray upholstered headboard and plenty of storage. Light-colored curtains give privacy without sacrificing the airy feel.

Bathroom Highlights

The bathroom has a spa-like quality, with natural stone tiles, a freestanding tub, and a double sink vanity with marble countertop. The shower is glass-enclosed with a rainfall showerhead, which adds a modern touch. Plenty of storage under the vanity and a large mirror with integrated lighting make this space both stylish and practical.

Overall, this place is a solid choice if you want something move-in ready with a good blend of comfort, style, and a bit of that city buzz without feeling overwhelmed.

You'll probably spend a lot of your time in the open-plan living and dining area, where the hardwood floors and neutral color palette create a calm, inviting space. The plush sectional sofa with plenty of cushions makes it easy to relax, and the black dining table with upholstered chairs feels both modern and comfortable—plus there's a stylish pendant light overhead adding subtle warmth.

Kitchen and Bathrooms Made for Convenience

The kitchen is sleek and built for practical use, featuring white cabinetry with clean handles, black granite countertops, and modern appliances including a built-in microwave, oven, and stainless steel range hood. A breakfast bar with seating means you can grab quick meals or chat while cooking. In the bathroom, enjoy a relaxing jacuzzi bathtub with jets and a separate glass shower enclosure—both benefiting from the same bright, airy feel as the rest of the condo.

Enjoy Your Own Private Oasis

Arguably the highlight is the private outdoor pool right off the balcony, tiled with care and enclosed by a glass railing that keeps the high-rise city views unobstructed. It’s a rare find, giving you a perfect mix of privacy and scenery. The balcony itself offers extra outdoor space, ideal for morning coffee or unwinding at sunset.

property_description:
Welcome to your new home on Sukhumvit Soi 16

This 1-bedroom, 2-bath unit on the 9th floor offers a smart, open-plan layout that's perfect if you appreciate minimalist style without feeling cold. You’ve got about 76 sqm, so it’s spacious enough to live comfortably but still manageable to keep clean.

Living area and kitchen

You’ll probably spend most of your time here—there’s a white sectional sofa with patterned cushions that make it feel cozy, plus a wall-mounted flat-screen TV right opposite. Light wood floors run throughout, adding warmth and making the space feel bright. The kitchen is minimal but practical: white cabinets, black countertops, and built-in appliances including a dishwasher and an oven. Under-cabinet lighting keeps things well-lit when you cook, and the compact layout maximizes the space nicely. There’s even a mini home bar setup if you like to entertain.

Other features

  • Two bathrooms with modern vanities and backlit mirrors
  • Floor-to-ceiling sheer and blackout curtains in living and bedroom for privacy or darkening
  • Sliding glass door opens to a balcony where you can enjoy some fresh air
  • Built-in washing machine and a black fridge tucked neatly in the kitchen area
  • Decorative shelving and ceiling lighting give the space a polished, contemporary feel

It’s a freehold resale, so you’re not just renting here. Being in Khlong Toei means easy access to central Bangkok yet tucked away enough for comfort. If you want a place that looks modern but feels like a real home, this one’s worth a look.

property_description:
This unit features 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and 127 sq.m. of living space. A rare high-floor residence, it boasts expansive skyline views and a spacious private balcony. Fully remodeled in a modern New York loft style, the unit includes exposed concrete ceilings, an office nook, and a bright open-plan living area with floor-to-ceiling windows and triple-length terrace doors. With only 4 units per floor, privacy and exclusivity are assured.

Lake Avenue offers premium facilities, including 24-hour security, a swimming pool, fitness center, covered parking, and a welcoming lobby. The building is well-maintained and known for its low density, offering residents peace and quiet.

Ideally located in the heart of Sukhumvit Soi 16, Lake Avenue is just a short walk from BTS Asoke, MRT Sukhumvit, Terminal 21, and Benjakitti Park. Surrounded by restaurants, cafes, and convenience stores, the location provides unmatched urban living in a tranquil yet central neighborhood.
